content.description:
Ariadne addresses her absent lover.
 Quaenam te genuitgigno, gignere, genui: to give birth to sola sub ruperupes, rupis f.: a rock, cliff leaena,leaena, -ae f.: a lioness
 quod mare conceptum spumantibusspumo, spumare: to foam, froth exspuit undis,
 quae Syrtis,Syrtis, -is f.: two sand-banks on the coast of Africa quae Scylla rapax, quae vasta Charybdis,
 talia qui reddisreddo, reddere: to give back pro dulci praemia vita?
content.question: In Greco-Roman mythology, who abandoned Ariadne?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
